parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent stalling and sputtering of the vehicle can cause accidents, especially when the vehicle is idling or in slow-moving traffic, and can lead to a loss of control or sudden stops.
symptoms: The vehicle stalls or sputters sporadically
usually when idling or in slow-moving traffic
accompanied by a strange knocking noise behind the steering wheel
occasional backfiring
and a sudden loss of power.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Fire Due to Electrical Short
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An electrical short in the engine can cause a fire, resulting in significant damage to the vehicle and potentially harming occupants.
symptoms: The vehicle catches fire
often due to an electrical short
resulting in significant damage to the engine and surrounding components.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The electrical failure of the seat warmer can cause a short circuit, leading to a fire hazard, damage to the seat, and potentially harm to the occupants.
symptoms: Burn holes in the seat
smoke or burning smell
seat warmer malfunctioning or not functioning at all.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent no-start condition can leave the driver stranded, cause inconvenience, and potentially lead to safety issues if the vehicle is unable to start in a hazardous location.
symptoms: The vehicle fails to start
the engine crank but does not start
the vehicle starts intermittently.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the dual mass flywheel can cause the vehicle to shake and vibrate, leading to poor shifting, and potentially leaving the driver stranded. If left unaddressed, it can also cause damage to other components, such as the clutch disc and pressure plate.
symptoms: The clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the vehicle shakes and vibrates at idle
the vehicle makes a ticking or rattling noise when the engine is revved
the gear engages immediately when lifting off the clutch pedal
difficulty shifting into gear
hesitation or stalling when starting from a stopped position.
